avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are present on W-facing aspects. E storm is expected on Friday night with continuing wind slab and cornice formation.

snowpackStructure.highlights: This week there has been significant snowing in strong E- directions. Wind slabs have formed in the mountains on west facing aspects. Little snow was present before but in upper elevations and inland the snow that was present has strengthened after warming and subsequent freezing. Significant amount of new snow is expected on Friday night during stiff easterlies with more wind slab and cornice formation.

travelAdvisory.comment:
Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland. An easterly snow storm went over South Iceland last night, and unstable wind slabs are likely present in the mountains.
Wind slabs and weak layers are present in N- and E- Iceland. Avalanches have released on interface between new snow and older firn where weakness is widespread in North and East parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á föstudag hvessir í austan 13-18 m/s og byrjar að snjóa fyrir miðnætti og stendur fram á miðja nótt. Á laugardag lægir aftur og verður úrkomulaust fram yfir helgi.

avalancheActivity.highlights: A little recent snow is on top of either bare ground or older snow which is considered stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A little recent snow is on top of either bare ground or older snow which is considered stable. A little snow is expected to add during the weekend, and drift on Sunday in NE winds.

travelAdvisory.comment:
Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland. An easterly snow storm went over South Iceland last night, and unstable wind slabs are likely present in the mountains.
Wind slabs and weak layers are present in N- and E- Iceland. Avalanches have released on interface between new snow and older firn where weakness is widespread in North and East parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Vægara frost á laugardag en hefur verið, lítilsháttar él og hægur vindur. Kólnar aftur á sunnudag og hvessir úr NA.

avalancheActivity.comment: An avalanche was reported on a S aspect in Hrafnabjargarhnjúkur, Karlsárdalur on Thursday. The avalanche is likely to have released on the interface between older firn and wind slab that formed this week. A large slab avalanche size 2.5 and two smaller ones, one remote triggered released in Burstarbrekkudalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A persistant weakness is widespread in the area where new snow lies on older firn. Wind slabs may form on N-aspects during southerlies over the weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Strong N snow fall on Tuesday formed slabs in S aspects but surface snow is light and will easily blow into slabs on N sides in S winds and snow showers over the weekend. Underlying snow is considered stable. This last week has been very cold, enhancing the temperature gradient in the snow pack. A snow pit from Leyningssúlur, near Siglufjörður on NE-aspect Jan 17th, showed a steep temperature gradient and faceting. Stability tests gave a sudden planar fracture at medium load on the interface between firn and new snow. Whumpfs observed recently indicate a widespread weakness underneath new snow. Some wind slabs may form on N aspects during southerlies over the weekend.

travelAdvisory.comment:
Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland. An easterly snow storm went over South Iceland last night, and unstable wind slabs are likely present in the mountains.
Wind slabs and weak layers are present in N- and E- Iceland. Avalanches have released on interface between new snow and older firn where weakness is widespread in North and East parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á föstudag frost 6 til 17 stig. Gengur í suðaustan 8-15 föstudagskvöld og dregur úr frosti. Snýst í suðvestan 5-13 á laugardag, dálítil snjókoma og vægt frost.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few slab avalanches were seen in Eskifjörður, probably released during or after the snowfall on Tuesday, 16.1.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow that fell last Tuesday has drifted and formed wind slabs, especially in slopes facing the south and east. Weak layers with facets have been found between the wind slab and the underlying stable and hardpacked snow. On Friday night, snowfall is forecasted in E winds and that might trigger avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of snow fell on Tuesday. It drifted and formed wind slabs, especially in south- and east-facing slopes. Underneath is stable hardpacked snow, and between those two a weak layer with facets has been found. The fracture probability appears to vary greatly from place to place. Heavy snowfall is forecasted for a short time on Friday night, with E winds. New wind slabs are expected to form in west-facing slopes. Also, the increased load can trigger avalanches on the previously mentioned weak layer.

travelAdvisory.comment:
Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland. An easterly snow storm went over South Iceland last night, and unstable wind slabs are likely present in the mountains.
Wind slabs and weak layers are present in N- and E- Iceland. Avalanches have released on interface between new snow and older firn where weakness is widespread in North and East parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been cancelled for South Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áköf snjókoma í 2-3 klst aðfaranótt laugardags, samfara hvassri A-átt. Á sunnudagsmorgun dregur úr frosti, styttir síðan upp og snýst í SV-átt. Eftir það þurrt að mestu nema smá él seinnipart sunnudags. Kólnar aftur mikið á mánudag.
